intro: Evrardiella dodecandra, commonly known as the African blue milkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, brown seeds. Evrardiella dodecandra is adapted to grow in well-drained soils and can thrive in full sun, making it a resilient species in arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important plant in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
